intro: Dryandra cordata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, evergreen leaves. The plant produces striking, cone-like inflorescences that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the dry, Mediterranean climate of its native region. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
